fields.creole: Langa  ago wii  yuuz  tu  plou  wid  aksn  orli  in  di  marning
fields.english: Long ago we used to plough [farm] with oxen early in the morning.

fields.creole: Wii  gatu  get  op an  teek  ouar  breekfas  an
fields.english: We had to get up and have breakfast

fields.creole: den  tek  ouar  lonsh an  den  wii go  dong  a  di  bak  wee.
fields.english: then we went down to the back way.

fields.creole: Wii  gatu  waak  trii  or  foo  mailz  fu  fain  di   aksn.
fields.english: We had to walk three or four miles to find the oxen.

fields.creole: Den  wen  wii  kom  bak  wii  gatu  put  aam ...
fields.english: Then when we came back we had to put them on ...

fields.creole: juat  on  dee  nek.  An den wii gatu put on  di plou.
fields.english: yoke on the [oxen’s] necks. And then we had to put on the plough.

fields.creole: Den  fram  de wii  hav  tu  ajos  di plou
fields.english: Then from there we had to adjust the plough

fields.creole: den  wii  gatu staat tu  plou.
fields.english: then we had to start to plough.

fields.creole: Den  som  a  di  aksn  das  ron
fields.english: Then some of the oxen would run off

fields.creole: an  get  dee  fut  kot  op
fields.english: get their feet cut up.

fields.creole: An  sontaim  di  laan  das  haad
fields.english: Sometimes the land was very hard

fields.creole: an  wi das  gatu  chrai  tu plou  it.
fields.english: and (yet) we had to try to plough it.

fields.creole: An  wen  wii  finish  plou a  kot
fields.english: And when we finished ploughing one row

fields.creole: Den  wen  wii  wii  gan  shai  di  di   padi
fields.english: Then when we – we would scatter the paddy (to sow it)

fields.creole: den  wii  go  kom  wid bush  an  wii gon
fields.english: then we would get bush and we would

fields.creole: haal  di  bush  on  it  an  kova  di  padi.
fields.english: drag the bush over it and cover over the paddy.

fields.creole: An  wen  reen  faal  dem  staat  tu  groo.
fields.english: And when it rained then they (the rice plants) started to grow.

fields.creole: Wen it groo mont or  tu sotaim i  ful  wid gras.
fields.english: When it (the rice plants) grew for a month or two sometimes it was full of grass.

fields.creole: Den  juring  di  reeni  siizn  laik  bout  juun  o  julai
fields.english: Then during the rainy season

fields.creole: wii  gatu  goo an kliin biizi-biizi
fields.english: we had to go and clean out the bizii-bizii weeds (from the midst of the rice plants).

fields.creole: An den wen wii an  wi  gatu  pach  di rais.
fields.english: And then we had to patch the rice (possibly ‘planting fresh plants where the weeds had been’).

fields.creole: An wii finish den rong bout aagas taim wi finish.
fields.english: We would finish patching around August.

fields.creole: An  aam … juring  about  septemba  tu  aktoba
fields.english: And ahm ….. during September to October

fields.creole: wi staat  tu  kot wid gras  naif.
fields.english: we would start to cut with grass knives.

fields.creole: An  wen  wii  finish kot  wii  das  gatu ...
fields.english: And when we finished cutting we would have to ...

fields.creole: e  fech  it  wid  di  aksn  wid kyart
fields.english: er use oxen attached either to a cart

fields.creole: ar  som kain  a  draga  an
fields.english: or other vehicle that could be dragged,

fields.creole: wen wii  pak  op  aal  di straa  dat  wi  kot
fields.english: to take away the cut rice plants and when we had stacked all the stalks we had cut,

fields.creole: wi  gatu  mash  it  wid aksn.
fields.english: then we had to use oxen to trample them.

fields.creole: Wi  gatu get  baiz  jraiving  di aksn rong an rong.
fields.english: We had to get boys to drive the oxen around and around.

fields.creole: Wi  gatu get  a  kain tu chroowe   di   straa.
fields.english: We had to get a kind (meaning unclear) to get rid of the chaff.

fields.creole: Wen  wi  finish  wi  gatu  hiip  op  di  padi.
fields.english: When finished we had to heap up the paddy.

fields.creole: Den  wi  gatu win   it.
fields.english: Then we had to winnow it.

fields.creole: An  den  wi  gatu  transpoot  it
fields.english: After which we had to transport it

fields.creole: wid  bul  kyart  tu  di  rais  mil.
fields.english: using carts pulled by bulls to the rice mill.

fields.creole: Weer  weer  wi soold  di  padi da tu di mila
fields.english: Weer  weer  wi soold  di  padi da tu di mila

fields.creole: ar  wii  get it  mil  an  sel  di rais tu eni porsn  iz  baiin rais
fields.english: or we milled it and sold the rice to anyone who might be buying rice.

fields.creole: A.P:  hou  it  iz  don  tudee  nou?
fields.english: A.P: How is it done today now?

fields.creole: Wel  prezentli  nou  wii  get  chrakta.
fields.english: Well presently now we get tractors.

fields.creole: Wi  plou  di raisfiil  in  a  fiyu  ouarz taim,
fields.english: We plough the rice field in a few hours time.

fields.creole: An den wii kom  bak  an wii  riiplou
fields.english: And then we come back another time and plough for a second time

fields.creole: a  sekan  taim an den wii braadkyaas di  padi.
fields.english: and then we sow the paddy by scattering it across the ploughed area.

fields.creole: and then we sow the paddy by scattering it across the ploughed area.
fields.english: We cover the paddy with ‘chipa’ (small chips of dirt?) and when rain fall it grows.

fields.creole: An wii wach it fram  inseks an pes.
fields.english: And we protect the ricefield from insects and other pests.

fields.creole: An  wen  it  iz raip  wii  riip  it wid  kombain
fields.english: And when the paddy is ready, we harvest it with combined harvesters

fields.creole: an  wii get i:da  trok  ar tre:la
fields.english: and we use either trucks or trailers

fields.creole: tu teek it tu di mil weer wii soold it
fields.english: to take it to the mill where we either sell the paddy

fields.creole: or  konvertid  it  tu  rais.
fields.english: or convert it to rice.
